intro: Boehmeria platyphylla var. loochooensis, commonly known as the Loochoo nettle, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes many species of nettles. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and small greenish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its fibrous stems have been used traditionally for making textiles and paper.
